Chapter 5: The Difficult to Conquer Abode, Chapter on the Difficult to Conquer Abode
Vajra Treasury said:
There are also Buddha sons and great bodhisattvas who have already perfected the fourth abode;
Having accomplished the fourth abode, they can further advance to the fifth abode. They should practice ten intentions in order to attain realization.
What are the ten?ğŸ”½Remembering the Dharma of the Buddhas of the past;
Also contemplating the Dharma of the Buddhas of the future;
Also contemplating the Dharma of the Buddhas of the present;
Cultivating pure precepts;
Their minds are fresh and bright;
Eliminating the sixty-two views and doubts;
Understanding the pursuit of the Way, and also practicing purity;
The holy wisdom they practice is all seen as pure;
Analyzing all the supreme thirty-seven factors of enlightenment is also pure;
Transforming sentient beings, their practice is pure;
These are the ten matters.
Vajra Treasury said:

There are also Buddha sons and great beings who have attained the fifth stage, and then they accomplish the cultivation of good and wonderful deeds, practicing the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment with a very pure mind;
The path's work becomes even more excellent, and the vows are vast and extensive. Due to the power of the vows, they draw near to the Tathagata;
They have compassion for the multitude of beings and never forget to abandon them, accumulating merit and virtue, gathering the holy wisdom;
They diligently persevere without slacking off, using skillful means to guide those who are not yet there, and always delight in abiding in the wonderful radiance;
They secretly rejoice in the meaning established by the TathÄgata, and their own minds have already entered the power of the Buddha;

What they think is exclusively focused and irreversible, like thoroughly understanding and comprehending these four noble truths, which are the truth of suffering, the truth of the accumulation [of suffering], the truth of cessation [of suffering], and the truth of the path [to cessation];
They are able to ultimately reach the truth of virtue, discerning the noble truths and penetrating their fundamental limits;
Understanding all characteristics, the true and correct holy truths;
Those without skillful means, in accordance with the proclamation, understanding the true and correct, discerning these truths;
The holy truths of causal practice, analyzing their events, the holy truths of liberation;
Those who are able to practice, all understanding the events, the holy truths of correct action.

Next, proclaiming the holy truths of practicing the Way, expounding their meaning, the truth of the end of birth, realizing and entering the Way of holy truths, all have already universally entered the abodes of the bodhisattvas;
Accomplishing and approaching, up to eloquence, the great wisdom of the TathÄgata, dispelling afflictions, proclaiming the holy truths.

Moreover, being able to transform the thoughts of others, all making them delighted, understanding according to the time, thoroughly comprehending the holy truths, already able to enter the meaning of the Way of one cause, turning to understand, penetrating to the source the true and correct holy truths.

If one awakens to one's own characteristics, one will be able to understand the noble truth of characteristics. If one understands the nature of the mind's destination, one will penetrate the five aggregates, the various kinds of afflictions, and the separate places of origin, and through the noble truths, one will understand the arising of the various afflictions of the body.

Understanding the noble truth of suffering, one will then be able to understand the noble truth of the accumulation of suffering. If one thoroughly understands the source of suffering, then one will be able to understand the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.

If one has no second thought, and speaks in accordance with the meaning, then one will be able to understand the noble wisdom of the path. If one fully awakens to the wisdom of the TathÄgata, then one will be able to understand the noble truth of the practice of truth. If one has the power of faith and wisdom, and understands what is not exhausted, and causes suffering to have no remainder, then if one contemplates the truths in this way, one will be able to subdue the source of birth and death, and understand the places from which everything arises.

Because of this, the false and foolish do what is not true. Understanding the beginning and end, they pity sentient beings, and with great compassion, they give rise to boundless kindness in the world. Having already attained this wisdom power and the wealth of the Way, they universally protect all beings. They delight in the Buddha's wisdom and contemplate the past, where they have gone in birth and death. Observing their original source, from where sentient beings come, they reach this ignorance and the three places of affection and love, drifting in the current of birth and death, attached to the five hindrances and coverings, moving and turning for them, increasing the suffering aggregates.

If one can understand that there are no sentient beings, no self, no person, no life, and no lifespan, having already left behind the self, all of this is understood, just like past events, the future and present are also like this.
They long for the empty and foolish karma of birth and death, wandering without end, forever without limits, without protection, and without knowledge.

They have no teachers or friends, and even if they have teachers and friends, they do not accept the teachings of the Way. They are ignorant, foolish, and deluded ordinary beings, bound by the cover of sleep, beyond measure.
They destroy themselves, and what is to be extinguished will be extinguished, never to arise again. They do not believe in the Buddha's Way, and it only increases.

They suffer from afflictions, conditioned by birth and death, and what they see is carried away by the current. They do not abandon the cover of the aggregates, are not disgusted with the four elements, do not pull out the sores of arrogance and views, do not distinguish lust and anger, and do not eliminate ignorance.

In the dark room, they do not exhaust the difficulties of the pool of love and desire, do not seek the work of the guide of the ten powers, enter into the actions of Mara, and fall into the sea of birth and death, turning over and over.
They have no thought of goodness, and leave self-mastery behind. Such suffering and affliction are beyond measure.

Forever without protection, nowhere to go, no rescue, no benefit or meaning, alone, without companions, one should practice such deeds, accumulating merit and virtue, conquering oneself in every life, and thus being able to cultivate wisdom. Having already attained understanding of all beings, ultimately pure, one then accomplishes the ten powers.
Expounding the wisdom of non-action, lofty and bright, such is the wisdom that the mind has already realized, attaining the accomplishment of the Way, and the practices to be undertaken.

Accumulating merit and virtue, all for the sake of sentient beings, establishing protection, having compassion for the multitude, universally comforting all beings, extending mercy to all, wishing to deliver them.
Without a mind of harm or slander, encouraging sentient beings to transform, none are not delighted.
Being their guide, causing them to attain nirvana, having diligently cultivated, one abides in the fifth difficult-to-conquer ground.

By attaining mastery, the mind forgets nothing. Understanding the practices and their effects everywhere, the will is firm. Discriminating wisdom is excellent. The mind reaches everywhere. Understanding the sequence of sutras, the meaning of the chapters and sentences, the mind is filled with shame. Protecting both self and others, the mind is courageous.
Nurturing the precepts, following without transgression, the mind is clear. Announcing everywhere the correct practices to be engaged in, one enters the assembly of sages without relying on anything.
Going back and forth with wisdom, proclaiming the meaning, scattering it in a timely manner, one attains the practice of spiritual powers.

Using skillful means to reveal the transformation of the Way, cultivating skillful means, guiding in accordance with worldly customs, accumulating merit and virtue, never being content, aspiring to seek the wisdom of the Way, never slacking off, upholding boundless compassion, gathering pity and sympathy, the mind never lazy, seeking the Way and its practices.
Not retreating in leisure, diligently striving for the ten powers and fearless wisdom of the Buddha.
The Dharma of all Buddhas is eighteen kinds of uncommon qualities, always using good practices, contemplating deeply and entering into the adornment of the Buddha land.

Establishing various practices, accumulating and collecting the characteristics and marks, always practicing diligently, aspiring to seek the TathÄgata's pure adornment of body, speech, and mind, cultivating ultimate deeds, respecting and revering the precepts, following all bodhisattvas, cherishing the Dharma masters, and being free from harm.

Using the skillful means of all bodhisattvas, universally wandering in the world, single-mindedly and diligently throughout the day and night, abandoning other thoughts, always using the Dharma to diligently transform sentient beings, able to cultivate in this way.
Using the practice of giving, encouraging and guiding sentient beings, loving and respecting beneficial words, greatly benefiting them, equally rescuing all people.

He then manifests a physical form to expound the Dharma, and in accordance with this, he practices the great deeds of the bodhisattva-tathÄgatas, guiding and transforming the masses. He then sees the faults of birth and death, and praises the sagely wisdom and merits of the buddhas, and is able to act in this way.
With great spiritual powers, he transforms and moves, using various skillful means to guide and transform sentient beings.

Having already been able to diligently transform in this way, he enters the wisdom of the Buddha, and with a mind and conduct that do not regress, he cultivates the roots of virtue and diligently seeks the extraordinary true Dharma.

He had compassion for sentient beings. Wherever he traveled in the world, he wrote treatises and scriptures, stamped with the seals of the assemblies, calculated and guarded the various bodies and seeds, and treated illnesses with medicine and various diseases, cold and heat, emaciation, being possessed by ghosts and spirits, being poisoned and having insanity. If there were those who chased after him, he healed their bodies wherever they were, combined techniques, jumped and joked, bringing much joy, in the counties, countries, towns, rivers, springs, ponds, trees, flowers, fruits, and medicinal herbs that grew.

Gold, silver, bright moon, pearls, jade, crystal, and the various treasures that appeared, such as glass, the sun and moon, villages, towns, homes, fields, the shaking of the earth, the strange responses in dreams, and all the forms and appearances of the various bodies that entered.

They should diligently practice and cultivate all the characteristics and what should be cultivated and corrected. With wealth, business, and spiritual powers, they should be free from negligence and practice the four immeasurable minds with utmost sincerity, without any harm.

They should have compassion for sentient beings and cultivate lasting peace. With this practice, they should have compassion for the world and gradually establish them in the true Dharma of the Buddhas, able to transform and establish them.

The bodhisattva of the stage of overcoming difficulties makes offerings to innumerable hundreds of thousands of myriads of koá¹­is of nayutas of Buddhas, with robes, food and drink, bedding, and medicine for illness.
In the presence of the TathÄgatas, they abandon worldly affairs, leave home to become monks, and listen to and accept the sÅ«tras from the TathÄgatas, becoming Dharma teachers.

They further listen and attain innumerable hundreds of thousands of myriads of koá¹­is of nayutas of dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s over hundreds of thousands of myriads of koá¹­is of nayutas of kalpas, manifesting the fundamental virtues and ultimately purifying them;
It is also like when a Buddha-son's wonderful treasure and red sandalwood are placed together, they illuminate each other.
The bodhisattva is like this, abiding in the ground of the bodhisattva of the difficult to conquer.

With this root of virtue, cultivating skillful wisdom, the meaning of the Way gradually becomes lofty, increasing the Mahayana, responding to create merit and virtue, and the practice is without compare. It is like a Buddha-son's night-shining pearl in a village, universally illuminating the fields like a cloud wind blowing everywhere, floating and wandering, turning the heavenly palaces. The bodhisattva is like this, attaining the difficult to conquer abode.

With this root of virtue and skillful wisdom, the mind practice universally enters, always abiding in the world, and nothing can disturb it. This is the fifth abode of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's practice.

The bodhisattva abiding here delights in many things. If he becomes a heavenly king, he subdues all heterodox and different studies. For those who establish, he uses giving, loving-kindness, benefiting, and sharing equally. Seeing the thought of sentient beings, he never departs from the practice of the Buddha's teachings.

He then further universally remembered and contemplated the omniscient activities of the sages, thinking, By what means can I deliver sentient beings, up to the lofty and boundless path? In the time it takes to have an intention, in an instant of diligent effort, in a single moment, he attained countless billions of samadhis, saw countless hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas, surrounded by retinues, discussing the sutras and expounding the principles, and he was liberated by them. He established the power of vows and all became the extraordinary transformations of bodhisattvas, with merits that cannot be measured or limited, up to this for hundreds of thousands of billions of kalpas, no one can praise and proclaim his merits.
At that time, Vajra Treasury Bodhisattva Mahasattva, wanting to further expound this classic teaching, then spoke a verse, saying:
The fourth radiant abode is thus very pure;
The mind has already been equalized, contemplating the affairs of the three times.
This mind's practice of precepts, morality and virtue cultivate purity;
In an instant, they leave behind bonds and enter the fifth abode.
They contemplate the faculties and, upon hearing, do not turn back;
With the four establishments of mindfulness, they delight in the chapters of the path.
Having transcended, they roam in the five powers, destroying nothing;
Then, courageous and diligent, they attain the fifth abode.
Shame and dishonor are their garments, the fragrance of pure precepts;
The factors of enlightenment form their flower garlands, meditation their anointing.
Following the wisdom practices, the path's honor adorns their appearance;
DhÄraá¹‡Ä« is their garden and grove, the practice of samÄdhi is impartial.
They roam with the four bases of supernatural power, their pure mind is their brain;
Compassionate eyes of pity, they see the sagely wisdom with wondrous vision.
Grasping without a self, their mind subdues the defilements;
Then they enter the fifth, abiding as a lion among humans.
Just entering the fifth, the uniquely different stage of the path;
The path's practices become pure, and cultivation proceeds further upwards.
If one can purify one's intentions, then one will seek the supreme truth;
Having pity and loathing the many afflictions, one contemplates and removes thoughts of separation.
Accumulating the roots of merit, venerating wisdom is also like this;
Giving rise to countless assemblies, illuminating and manifesting the practice of the stages of the path.
Established by the Buddha, mindful of the noble intention without arrogance;
Understanding natural understanding, not neglecting the correct four truths.
Thoroughly penetrating the truth, nurturing and protecting the various faculties;
If one discerns the true reality, one will further transcend the buddhas.
Thus dissolving the attached mind, and practicing the truth of the path;
Equal intentions and the illumination of the path, up to being unobstructed.
With a subtle and true elegant mind, cultivating and refining this truth;
The honored one of the wisdom liberation gate, not harming, without obscurations.
Having cultivated the fundamental merits, practicing wisdom is extremely vast and far-reaching;
Transcending the various causes and conditions, delivering all the masses of people.
Those who harbor true intentions, accomplish such truths;
Personally comprehending and understanding, penetrating to the original purity without peace.
Compassionately pitying without attainment, then abiding in peace;
Because of the afflictions of sentient beings, seeking the wisdom of the blessed path.
Diligent in contemplating its origination, from the original source;
Foolishness arises from darkness and obscurity, closed in the seeds of affection and love.
Sentient beings greedily grasp the aggregates, then forming a body of suffering;
Having attained the absence of self, observing it like grass and trees.ğŸ”½From afflictions and dust, existence is brought forth, repeatedly going to various destinies;
Like a wheel turning without end, with the suffering, afflictions, and distress of the masses.
Alas, having lost the way, the multitude are to be pitied and grieved over;
They are emaciated by foolishness and stupidity, not returning from the flow of birth and death.
The five aggregates are like an ox, with the wounds of various wrong views;
The fire burns their hearts, their minds cherish the dark and obscure.
Falling into the river of desire, they now long for the manifest;
Dwelling in the river of hardship, they clearly seek the supreme guide.
Having seen such difficulties, one should cultivate without negligence;
All the practices one follows are used to deliver sentient beings.
With a strong will and peaceful conduct, one walks with the power of qi;
Being brave and bearing shame, one understands and achieves wisdom.
Accumulating merit without weariness, the holy and venerable ones practice like this;
The pure and white Dharma is tireless, and power is their intention.
This is the supreme field of blessings, proclaiming the characteristics of the enlightened mind;
Their work is never satiated, and they diligently have compassion for sentient beings.
In order to transform sentient beings, they go and enter the crafts;
Sometimes they are painters or engravers, counting people or treating illnesses.
They appear like ghosts and spirits causing harm, but by turning, they remove illnesses;
They establish the essentials of the sutras, understanding and awakening with joyful compassion.
They compose and sing songs, with various kinds of jokes and laughter;
Rivers, parks, bathing pools, trees, flowers, and fruits.
They establish countless occupations, using them to bring peace to sentient beings;
They manifest innumerable forms and colors, with various precious treasures.
They take the earth and cause it to quake, and then they see the light of the sun and moon;
The characteristics of sentient beings, wandering through various countries and places.
Formless wealth is supreme, with immeasurable spiritual powers;
Wishing to cultivate compassion, universally bringing peace to sentient beings.
This is called the difficult to conquer, the wondrous and sublime wisdom and action;
Making offerings to billions of buddhas, listening and receiving the scriptures together.
They cultivate the nature of kindness and compassion, and the pure and white practices are gradually revealed;
Like a purple gold chariot, polished and refined, becoming more and more beautiful.
The house is made of various treasures, the palace moves and travels;
This wind turns in front, there is no one who opposes or protects it.
Like practicing worldly dharmas, but for the sake of all beings;
Wandering in this group of enlightenment, like a lotus flower in the water.
In this place, performing arts, the construction is magnificent and noble;
Rejecting and abandoning the arts of other schools, seeing the practice of joyful events.
The various good virtues practiced are all due to the supreme wisdom;
Saving and protecting the multitude of people, thus attaining the ten powers.
Equal to the honored one, attaining majestic power, diligence is unsurpassed;
Seeing many billions, peacefully abiding as the Heaven of Heavens.
Attaining the wondrous samÄdhi, observing billions of lands;
Because the aspirations are exceptionally special, they surpass this merit and virtue.
This is the fifth stage, with billions of methods;
Restraining and transforming the multitude of deviant methods, manifesting and illuminating sentient beings.

At that time, the Buddha's disciples, hearing the proclamation of these bodhisattva practices, rose up from the ground and remained in the sky, joyfully raining down flowers, bright moon jewels, necklaces, and garments, with pure radiance, scattering and offering to the Buddha above, exclaiming Excellent!
All the spirits, dwelling in the sky, the hundreds of thousands of beings, were all exhilarated.

At that time, the heavenly beings offered various wonderful treasures to the Benefactor, as well as incense, flowers, fragrant ointments, silk banners, canopies, and other magical objects. The retinue of MÄra, the heavenly beings, and the sons of the Buddha all came and gathered above in the sky, walking in the void. They rained down various precious flowers, their minds filled with joy, making offerings to the Supreme One. Their thoughts were immeasurable, and they exclaimed Excellent!
The multitudes of spiritual beings, countless millions, also gathered above, beating
various musical instruments, their sounds clear and harmonious. Moreover, all the music produced this sound: The Buddha's
voice is gentle and harmonious, dispelling evil dust. Originally pure and empty, it eliminates all conceptual thoughts of dharmas, just like

If one understands that all dharmas are ultimately non-existent, then one will accomplish the rootless,
and without any existent karma, one will not give rise to thoughts. Having compassion for sentient beings, one diligently cultivates in order to save and liberate them.
This is how the Buddha's disciples, the children of the Dharma King, cultivate the practice of giving. They all let go of attachments and their precepts are firm and

Chapter 6: Abiding in the Present Moment, from the Sutra of the Gradual Increase of Practice Chapter 6: Abiding in the Present Moment Vajragarbha said:
All Buddha's disciples, listen!
If a great bodhisattva has been able to cultivate and accomplish the fifth abode, he will immediately transcend and enter the sixth abode. He will then practice ten dharmas.
What are the ten?
Understanding that all dharmas are originally without thought, and thus universally equal;
All characteristics are level and have never had any form or class;
They are all unborn, transcending and beyond compare;
They are all unarisen, and thus said to be equal;
They are extremely pure, well-regulated, and genuine;
They are all without negligence, not running or chasing;
There is no correspondence or non-correspondence, no entanglement or singleness;
They are tranquil and level, without compare;
Like illusions, dreams, shadows, echoes in the mountains, the reflection of the moon in water, and so forth, they are also like transformations;
The path of practice is without a second thought;
These are the ten dharmas.

From the fifth ground to the sixth abode, having performed these practices, one naturally contemplates all these dharmas, calculates and ponders, examines them repeatedly, not allowing them to be confused, approaching the sixth abode.
Naturally seeing with the eyes, having attained and accomplished this, one then obtains penetration, the receptivity of the Dharma of gentle accord.

Not from delusion, one has not yet approached the receptivity of the Dharma of non-arising, but gradually approaching it, one can attain spontaneity, entering into all places of the dharmas, able to progress further, attaining great compassion, becoming the foremost, manifesting great compassion, replete with boundless pity.
Understanding the five destinies of the world, existence and non-existence, combination and dispersion, observing in this way, is called the sixth abode.
Then understanding worldly practices that can lead to birth, all arising from reliance on self, caused by the self, realizing desires.
The world is non-existent, those with foolish thoughts rely on and attach to the self, due to their lack of wisdom, they form delusion.

Seeking to enjoy the place of birth, practicing non-conforming karma, aspiring to run away, the practice of turning away from evil, accumulating various merits and demerits, and the rise and fall of blessings and sins.

All things are impermanent, due to the uselessness of life, understanding this practice, the mind skillfully cultivates itself, eliminating all defilements, and reaching the original non-existence of truth;

That which gives rise to good virtue, therefore, should return and roam the land of karmic retribution of birth and death, what is done is the field, the spirit is the seed, the root of ignorance is then the darkness;
Love is the moistening, arrogance is its disposition, nurturing the net of various views and bonds;
Causing the self to obtain this, and giving rise to name-and-form;
Turning and increasing name-and-form, then forming the various faculties;
Having already formed the faculties, giving rise to various kinds of things that are experienced and practiced;
Having given rise to the things that are practiced, there is then feeling;
From feeling, there is then joy and pleasure, which then increases the things that are received;
By benefiting what is received, one immediately accomplishes what exists;
Giving rise to the intention to accomplish, accomplishing the arising of thoughts, and thus accomplishing the form of the five aggregates and five elements;
Gradually arriving at the five destinies, gradually becoming attached, up to all attachments;
All dependencies are fully equipped, and thus give rise to vexation, burning, and all the suffering of sorrow and crying.
All unwholesome karma is originally empty and formless. Not understanding and acquiring practice, there is no confusion or distinction;
All are also naturally gradually practicing without obstruction, and thus attain this;
If one understands this meaning, then there is nothing to aspire to.
Bodhisattvas are like this, delighting in gentleness, contemplating the twelve links of dependent arising, and then contemplate thus: By this sincerity, this is the consciousness that arises.
Ultimately without wisdom, the karma of ignorance is originally pure, and the practice results in retribution.
What is practiced is accomplished, and consciousness precedes. The companions of consciousness receive the four aggregates, and thus lead to the deluded events of name-and-form.
The six sense bases are the conditions for the arising of consciousness.
Together with the companions, the various defilements, they form feelings of pain and pleasure. Due to craving, they increase their experience.

By controlling what is experienced, they create defiled karma. From what is done, the aggregates of birth and body arise. Within this birth, they lead to old age and weakness. The aggregates of the body disintegrate, leading to death.
Together with ignorance, it is very frightening.

From this danger, up to dwelling in the net of bonds, leading to verbal expressions, this is the arising of the five sense faculties. Suffering arises from the mental faculty, and due to its worries and sorrows, it causes much distress. Based on this, one forms existence. For this reason, one retreats and gives rise to the tree of suffering. What is created is observed by oneself. Relying on what is done, one knows what is done. One plans to be the doer. Considering that there is creation, there is nothing done. The beginning and end are signless and also cannot be obtained.
Moreover, contemplating the three realms, they are created by the mind. The twelve links of dependent origination are calculated in this way.
The five destinies to which one returns are understood and mastered by the TathÄgata. Moreover, all of these are of one kind, with the mind simultaneously accomplishing them together.
Why is it so?

If the various faculties and so forth give rise to greed and desire, they are all due to the delusion of birth and death in the spirit and consciousness. From ignorance, what is called name-and-form has the mind as a companion and establishes confusion. From that name-and-form, name-and-form is accomplished, becoming the six sense bases. From that, one experiences and becomes a companion of pain and itching. Due to the love of pain and itching, there is love. From not abandoning what is received, one gives rise to various difficulties. Due to the combination of these conditions, one attains what exists. Relying on that, one gives rise to birth. The arising of the net of vows and old age and death is due to the spirit and consciousness. From that, this existence is attained. What is separately called name-and-form is the condition.

The names and forms each have their own realm, and the six sense faculties and sense objects have already seen their own realm, but they are able to enter into tranquility due to the condition of contact.
From that contact, the mind gives rise to it, and the condition of feeling is produced.
Because of feeling, one then again creates good, evil, beautiful, and ugly actions.
From the condition of craving, it leads to the affairs of lustful desires and greed.
From the condition of craving, it leads to the prison of bondage.
From the condition of existence, it leads to rebirth in other lives. The present place of birth cannot be understood.
The condition of birth gives rise to the five aggregates, leading to the condition of aging, which leads to old age, and then the faculties become mature and lead to death.
Up to death, there are twelve things that give rise to the place of dependent origination. The body aggregate is destroyed, but it cannot be cut off, and has never been permanently severed.

From the condition of ignorance, it leads to the various activities, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age, sickness, and death, as well as sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress.
Because of the condition of ignorance, there is no cessation, no thorough understanding, and thus there is remainder.
When ignorance is eliminated, the various activities cease, and thus there is only this, and thus there is remainder.

Because of the acceptance of ignorance and craving, afflictions increase, with no time of cessation, as well as the activities that are done, going back and forth in response, with the responses revolving, and no time of uprooting. For those who exhaust their remaining misfortune, suffering and pain constantly change, also without rest, because of ignorance.

For the past, present, and future, seeing is spread by bondage, and should be severed. Thus, turning three times, turning three times without self, by being apart from self, ignorance is eliminated, and natural karma has no place.

It is like a reed house, or a clear pool, or suffering and distress. Because of ignorance, there is action. This is the root of past pain. Because of consciousness, it leads to pain and itching. This is the present practice of pain and itching.
From craving comes existence. This is the source of future pain and itching. Above this, there is nothing to be born.

When ignorance is eliminated, the various practices are extinguished, and the three sufferings and twelve consequences that arise from causes and conditions are also cut off. From ignorance, it leads to the six sense bases. This can extinguish the practices.
When the various practices are extinguished, it leads to the separation of the remaining two things, which are self-bound and painful.
There is still the suffering of separation. When ignorance is eliminated, the various practices are extinguished, and the three sufferings are permanently severed.
It is due to ignorance that various activities arise. It is due to the conditions of karma that various activities come to be. Thus, there is remainder.
When ignorance is eliminated, various activities cease. This is the remainder of all activities.
There is ignorance and karma. Using skillful means, one resolves great bonds. Because there is remainder, there is cyclic existence.

One should contemplate the cessation of the twelve links of dependent origination and where they lead. By examining them repeatedly, one realizes that they exist due to causes and conditions. One diligently relies on them, controlling body, speech, and mind. The conditions one creates lead to rebirth. There are three turnings, causing them to no longer turn. Past suffering and habitual tendencies lead to the three kinds of suffering. One cultivates the responses of various conditions of dependent origination.
Suppose someone takes on debts but is released from bondage. Observing them as endless, one exhausts what has no existence.
When they observe these conditions, as soon as the conditions arise, they will understand all future events.
There is no self, no person, no life, and naturally empty, tranquil, and peaceful, with something created, one encounters and receives retribution, following the gate of liberation of emptiness.
The mind embraces this, like this extinction, without remainder, the present place.

Contemplating and focusing the mind on the gate of liberation of signlessness, therefore knowing it, without any delight, only aspiring to great compassion, teaching and transforming beings from the past, this is embracing the mind of the gate of liberation of wishlessness, being able to practice these three gates of liberation, then eliminating the practice and views of self and other, and the attachment to various signs of existence and non-existence, and further advancing with great compassion, being without benefit, then diligently progressing, transforming all ordinary beings who have not yet attained the Way, enabling them to fully understand.
